title: Oliver Atkins Farwell
text:
Oliver Atkins Farwell (13 December 1867, <a href="Dorchester%2C%20Boston">Dorchester, Boston</a>, Massachusetts – 18 September 1944, <a href="Lake%20Linden%2C%20Michigan">Lake Linden, Michigan</a>) was a herbarium curator, botanist, and drug inspector.
As a boy he moved with his family to Michigan, where he was educated at public schools and the <a href="Michigan%20State%20Normal%20School">Michigan State Normal School</a>. He taught in 1889 and 1890 at Michigan state secondary schools and from 1890 to 1892 at Michigan State Normal School. In 1892 Farwell became a herbarium curator and drug inspector for <a href="Parke%2C%20Davis%20and%20Company">Parke, Davis and Company</a> and retired there in 1933. <a href="Rogers%20McVaugh">Rogers McVaugh</a>, <a href="Stanley%20A.%20Cain">Stanley A. Cain</a>, and Dale J. Hagenah (1908–1971) wrote a 101-page account of Farwell's life and work.
